pages.title: Slick!
pages.text: With Blue Ice, you can decrease the friction of a frame block, when an entity walks over it up to a certain point. The amount is configurable. $(l)$(#f00)The Blue Ice item will be consumed in the action!$()

However, the prerequisite for this is that the frame or illusion block has already been "filled" with a block and imitates it. You cannot change the friction of an empty frame. This feature is supported by all frame and illusion blocks whose top face reaches the block height (e.g. the top part of stairs, ladders or trapdoors, but not buttons, pressure plates, carpets or daylight detectors).

pages.title: Greasy!
pages.text: With Honey Blocks (not Honeycomb Blocks), you can increase the friction of a frame block, when an entity walks over it up to a certain point. The amount is configurable. $(l)$(#f00)The Honey Block item will be consumed in the action!$()

However, the prerequisite for this is that the frame or illusion block has already been "filled" with a block and imitates it. You cannot change the friction of an empty frame. This feature is supported by all frame and illusion blocks whose top face reaches the block height (e.g. the top part of stairs, ladders or trapdoors, but not buttons, pressure plates, carpets or daylight detectors).
